tool.name: SAGA.ta_preprocessor.4
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayELEV False output_data_FILLED $output_data_FILLED output_data_FDIR $output_data_FDIR output_data_WSHED $output_data_WSHED name SAGA.ta_preprocessor.4 ELEV $ELEV MINSLOPE $MINSLOPE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_FILLED $OutputSection_FILLED.outputType_FILLED transmissionMode_FILLED $OutputSection_FILLED.transmissionMode_FILLED outputType_FDIR $OutputSection_FDIR.outputType_FDIR transmissionMode_FDIR $OutputSection_FDIR.transmissionMode_FDIR outputType_WSHED $OutputSection_WSHED.outputType_WSHED transmissionMode_WSHED $OutputSection_WSHED.transmissionMode_WSHED

param.name: ELEV
param.label: DEM
param.help: Digital elevation model The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, png, tiff, x-ogc-envi

param.name: MINSLOPE
param.label: Minimum Slope [Degree]
param.help: Minimum slope gradient to preserve from cell to cell; with a value of zero sinks are filled up to the spill elevation (which results in flat areas). Unit [Degree]

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_FILLED
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_FILLED
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_FDIR
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_FDIR
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_WSHED
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_WSHED
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool uses an algorithm proposed by Wang & Liu to identify and fill surface depressions in digital elevation models.<br/>The method was enhanced to allow the creation of hydrologic sound elevation models, i.e. not only to fill the depression(s) but also to preserve a downward slope along the flow path. If desired, this is accomplished by preserving a minimum slope gradient (and thus elevation difference) between cells.<br/>This is the fully featured version of the tool creating a depression less DEM, a flow path grid and a grid with watershed basins. If you encounter problems processing large data sets (e.g. LIDAR data) with this tool try the basic version (Fill Sinks XXL).<br/><br/><br/>References:<br/>Wang, L. & H. Liu (2006): An efficient method for identifying and filling surface depressions in digital elevation models for hydrologic analysis and modelling. International Journal of Geographical Information Science, Vol. 20, No. 2: 193-213.<br/>
